annotators.name: abraom
annotators.title: ABRaOM
annotators.description: Exomic allele frequencies of an elderly cohort of Brazilians in the ABraOM database
annotators.citation: Naslavsky, Yamamoto et al. (2017). Exomic variants of an elderly cohort of Brazilians in the ABraOM database. Human Mutation, 38(7), 751â€“763.

annotators.name: alfa
annotators.title: ALFA: Allele Frequency Aggregator
annotators.description: The goal of the ALFA project is to make frequency data from over 1M dbGaP subjects open-access in future releases to facilitate discoveries and interpretations of common and rare variants with biological impacts or causing diseases.
annotators.citation: L. Phan, Y. Jin, H. Zhang, W. Qiang, E. Shekhtman, D. Shao, D. Revoe, R. Villamarin, E. Ivanchenko, M. Kimura, Z. Y. Wang, L. Hao, N. Sharopova, M. Bihan, A. Sturcke, M. Lee, N. Popova, W. Wu, C. Bastiani, M. Ward, J. B. Holmes, V. Lyoshin, K. Kaur, E. Moyer, M. Feolo, and B. L. Kattman. "ALFA: Allele Frequency Aggregator." National Center for Biotechnology Information, U.S. National Library of Medicine, 10 Mar. 2020, www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/snp/docs/gsr/alfa/.

annotators.name: allofus250k
annotators.title: All of Us
annotators.description: Allele counts and frequencies stratified by calculated genetic ancestry groupings from the All of Us dataset; Variant Annotation Table v7.1
annotators.developer: All of Us and the Baylor College of Medicine Human Genome Sequencing Center
annotators.citation: Bick, A. G. et al. Genomic data in the All of Us Research Program. Nature 627, 340–346 (2024).

annotators.name: aloft
annotators.title: ALoFT
annotators.description: ALoFT provides extensive annotations to putative loss-of-function variants (LoF) in protein-coding genes including functional, evolutionary and network features.
annotators.citation: Suganthi Balasubramanian, Yao Fu, Mayur Pawashe, Patrick McGillivray, Mike Jin, Jeremy Liu, Konrad J. Karczewski, Daniel G. MacArthur, and Mark Gerstein. "Using ALoFT to determine the impact of putative loss-of-function variants in protein-coding genes." Nature Communications 8 (2017).

annotators.name: alphamissense
annotators.title: AlphaMissense
annotators.description: Variant pathogenicity scores from AlphaMissense
annotators.citation: J. Cheng et al., Science 381, eadg7492 (2023). DOI: 10.1126/science.adg7492

annotators.name: arrvars
annotators.title: Arrhythmia Channelopathy Variants
annotators.description: Examines variants associated with arrhythmia diseases such as Brugada Syndrome and Long QT Syndrome.
annotators.developer: Vanderbilt University Medical Center for Arrhythmia Research and Therapeutics
annotators.citation: Kroncke, Brett M., et al. "A Bayesian method to estimate variant-induced disease penetrance." PLoS genetics 16.6 (2020): e1008862.

annotators.name: bayesdel
annotators.title: BayesDel
annotators.description: BayesDel is a deleteriousness meta-score predictor with pre-computed scores for missense variants.
annotators.citation: Feng, Bing-Jian. “PERCH: A Unified Framework for Disease Gene Prioritization.” Human mutation vol. 38,3 (2017): 243-251. doi:10.1002/humu.23158

annotators.name: biogrid
annotators.title: BioGRID
annotators.description: Comprehensive interaction repository
annotators.citation: Oughtred R, Stark C, Breitkreutz BJ, et al. (2018). The BioGRID interaction database: 2019 update. Nucleic Acids Res. 47(D1):D529-D541.

annotators.name: brca1_func_assay
annotators.title: BRCA1 Saturation Genome Editing Scores
annotators.description: Impact of BRCA1 missense variants on protein function as determined by multiplex homology-directed DNA repair assay
annotators.citation: Findlay, G.M., Daza, R.M., Martin, B., Zhang, M.D., Leith, A.P., Gasperini, M.J., Janizek, J.D., Huang, X., Starita, L.M., & Shendure, J. (2018). Accurate classification of BRCA1 variants with saturation genome editing. Nature, 1-6.

annotators.name: cadd
annotators.title: CADD
annotators.description: CADD is a tool for scoring the deleteriousness of single nucleotide variants in the human genome.
annotators.citation: Rentzsch P, Witten D, Cooper GM, Shendure J, Kircher M. CADD: predicting the deleteriousness of variants throughout the human genome. Nucleic Acids Res.2018 Oct 29. doi: 10.1093/nar/gky1016. PubMed PMID: 30371827.

annotators.name: cadd_exome
annotators.title: CADD Exome
annotators.description: CADD is a tool for scoring the deleteriousness of single nucleotide variants in the human genome.
annotators.citation: Rentzsch P, Witten D, Cooper GM, Shendure J, Kircher M. CADD: predicting the deleteriousness of variants throughout the human genome. Nucleic Acids Res. 2018 Oct 29. doi: 10.1093/nar/gky1016. PubMed PMID: 30371827.

annotators.name: cancer_genome_interpreter
annotators.title: Cancer Genome Interpreter
annotators.description: Flags validated oncogenic alterations and genomic biomarkers of drug response, while predicting cancer drivers among mutations of unknown significance.
annotators.developer: Global Alliance for Genomics and Health
annotators.citation: Tamborero, David, et al. "Cancer Genome Interpreter annotates the biological and clinical relevance of tumor alterations." Genome medicine 10.1 (2018): 25.

annotators.name: cancer_hotspots
annotators.title: Cancer Hotspots
annotators.description: A resource for statistically significant mutations in cancer.
annotators.citation: Chang et al., Accelerating discovery of functional mutant alleles in cancer. Cancer Discovery, 10.1158/2159-8290.CD-17-0321 (2017).

annotators.name: cardioboost
annotators.title: CardioBoost
annotators.description: Predicts pathogenicity of missense variants for inherited cardiac conditions
annotators.citation: Zhang, Xiaolei, et al. "Disease-specific variant pathogenicity prediction significantly improves variant interpretation in inherited cardiac conditions." bioRxiv (2020).

annotators.name: ccr
annotators.title: CCR: Constrained Coding Regions
annotators.description: The constrained coding regions model (CCR) uses the Genome Aggregation Database to reveal regions of protein coding genes that are likely to be under potentially purifiying selection.
annotators.citation: Havrilla, J.M., Pedersen, B.S., Layer, R.M. & Quinlan, A.R. A map of constrained coding regions in the human genome. Nature Genetics (2018). doi:10.1038/s41588-018-0294-6

annotators.name: ccre_screen
annotators.title: Candidate cis-Regulatory Elements by ENCODE (SCREEN)
annotators.description: SCREEN allows the user to explore Candidate cis-Regulatory Elements (cCREs) and investigate how these elements relate to other Encyclopedia annotations and raw ENCODE data.
annotators.developer: UMass Med, ENCODE Data Analysis Center
annotators.citation: ENCODE Project Consortium, Jill E. Moore, Michael J. Purcaro, Henry E. Pratt, Charles B. Epstein, Noam Shoresh, Jessika Adrian, et al. 2020. “Expanded Encyclopaedias of DNA Elements in the Human and Mouse Genomes.” Nature 583 (7818): 699–710.

annotators.name: cedar
annotators.title: CEDAR
annotators.description: Annotations from the Cancer Epitope Database
annotators.citation: Koşaloğlu-Yalçın Z, Blazeska N, Vita R, Carter H, Nielsen M, Schoenberger S, Sette A, Peters B. The Cancer Epitope Database and Analysis Resource (CEDAR). Nucleic Acids Res. 2023 Jan 6;51(D1):D845-D852. doi: 10.1093/nar/gkac902. PMID: 36250634; PMCID: PMC9825495

annotators.name: cgc
annotators.title: Cancer Gene Census
annotators.description: Cancer Gene Census annotation
annotators.citation: Futreal, P.A., Coin, L.J., Marshall, M., Down, T., Hubbard, T.L., Wooster, R., Rahman, N., & Stratton, M.R. (2004). A census of human cancer genes. Nature Reviews Cancer, 4, 177-183.

annotators.name: cgd
annotators.title: CGD: Clinical Genomic Database
annotators.description: A manually curated database of conditions with known genetic causes, focusing on medically significant genetic data with available interventions.
annotators.citation: Solomon BD, Nguyen AD, Bear KA, Wolfsberg TG. Clinical Genomic Database. Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 2013 May 21. [Epub ahead of print] [PubMed].

annotators.name: cgl
annotators.title: Cancer Gene Landscape
annotators.description: Oncogenes and tumor supressor genes from Vogelstein et al. 2013
annotators.citation: Vogelstein, B., Papadopoulos, N., Velculescu, V.E., Zhou, S., Diaz, L.A., & Kinzler, K.W. (2013). Cancer genome landscapes. Science, 339 6127, 1546-58.

annotators.name: chasmplus
annotators.title: CHASMplus
annotators.description: CHASMplus is a machine learning algorithm that discriminates somatic missense mutations as either cancer drivers or passengers. Predictions can be done in either a cancer type-specific manner or by a model considering multiple cancer types together (a useful default). Along with scoring each mutation, CHASMplus has a rigorous statistical model to evaluate the statistical significance of predictions. This OpenCRAVAT module represents the v1.0 precompute of CHASMplus (source code v1.0).
annotators.citation: Tokheim C, Karchin R. CHASMplus Reveals the Scope of Somatic Missense Mutations Driving Human Cancers. Cell Syst. 2019. doi: 10.1016/j.cels.2019.05.005. PubMed PMID: 31202631.

annotators.name: chasmplus_READ
annotators.title: CHASMplus READ
annotators.description: CHASMplus is a machine learning algorithm that discriminates somatic missense mutations as either cancer drivers or passengers. Predictions can be done in either a cancer type-specific manner or by a model considering multiple cancer types together (a useful default). annotators.citation: Tokheim C, Karchin R. CHASMplus Reveals the Scope of Somatic Missense Mutations Driving Human Cancers. Cell Syst. 2019. doi: 10.1016/j.cels.2019.05.005. PubMed PMID: 31202631.

annotators.name: civic
annotators.title: CIViC
annotators.description: Provides descriptions and linkouts to CIViC
annotators.developer: The McDonnell Genome Institute at Washington University School of Medicine
annotators.citation: Griffith, M., Spies, N.C., Krysiak, K., et al. (2017). CIViC is a community knowledgebase for expert crowdsourcing the clinical interpretation of variants in cancer. Nature Genetics, 49(2):170-174.

annotators.name: civic_gene
annotators.title: CIViC Gene
annotators.description: Provides descriptions and linkouts to CIViC
annotators.developer: The McDonnell Genome Institute at Washington University School of Medicine
annotators.citation: Griffith, M., Spies, N.C., Krysiak, K., et al. (2017). CIViC is a community knowledgebase for expert crowdsourcing the clinical interpretation of variants in cancer. Nature Genetics, 49(2):170-174.

annotators.name: clingen
annotators.title: ClinGen Gene
annotators.description: ClinGen is a National Institutes of Health (NIH)-funded resource dedicated to building a central resource that defines the clinical relevance of genes and variants for use in precision medicine and research.
annotators.citation: Strande NT, Riggs ER, Buchanan AH, Ceyhan-Birsoy O, DiStefano M, Dwight SS, Goldstein J, Ghosh R, Seifert BA, Sneddon TP, Wright MW, Milko LV, Cherry JM, Giovanni MA, Murray MF, O'Daniel JM, Ramos EM, Santani AB, Scott AF, Plon SE, Rehm HL, Martin CL, Berg JS. Evaluating the Clinical Validity of Gene-Disease Associations: An Evidence-Based Framework Developed by the Clinical Genome Resource. Am J Hum Genet. 2017 Jun 1;100(6):895-906. doi: 10.1016/j.ajhg.2017.04.015. Epub 2017 May 25. PubMed PMID: 28552198; PubMed Central PMCID: PMC5473734.

annotators.name: clingen_allele_registry
annotators.title: ClinGen Allele Registry
annotators.description: Provide Clingen Allele Registry Identifiers for variants.
annotators.citation: Pawliczek P, Patel RY, Ashmore LR, Jackson AR, Bizon C, Nelson T, Powell B, Freimuth RR, Strande N, Shah N, Paithankar S, Wright MW, Dwight S, Zhen J, Landrum M, McGarvey P, Babb L, Plon SE, Milosavljevic A, Clinical Genome (ClinGen) Resource. ClinGen Allele Registry links information about genetic variants. Hum Mutat. 2018 Nov,39(11) 1690-1701. doi 10.1002/humu.23637. PMID 30311374, PMCID PMC6519371.

annotators.name: clinpred
annotators.title: ClinPred
annotators.description: Prediction tool to identify disease-relevant nonsynonymous single nucleotide variants.
annotators.citation: Alirezaie N, Kernohan KD, Hartley T, Majewski J, Hocking TD. “ClinPred: Prediction Tool to Identify Disease-Relevant Nonsynonymous Single-Nucleotide Variants.”  American Journal of Human 2018 Oct 4;103(4):474-483. PMID:30220433

annotators.name: clinvar
annotators.title: ClinVar
annotators.description: ClinVar is an archive of reports of the relationships among human variations and phenotypes, with supporting evidence.
annotators.citation: Landrum, M.J., Lee, J.M., Benson, M., et al. (2016). ClinVar: public archive of interpretations of clinically relevant variants. Nucleic Acids Research, 44(D1):D862-8.

annotators.name: clinvar_acmg
annotators.title: ClinVar ACMG
annotators.description: ACMG PS1 and PM5 pathogenicity prediction based on ClinVar
annotators.citation: Landrum, M.J., Lee, J.M., Benson, M., et al. (2016). ClinVar: public archive of interpretations of clinically relevant variants. Nucleic Acids Research, 44(D1):D862-8.

annotators.name: cosmic
annotators.title: COSMIC
annotators.description: Catalogue Of Somatic Mutations In Cancer, is the world's largest and most comprehensive resource for exploring the impact of somatic mutations in human cancer.
annotators.citation: Forbes, S.A., Beare, D., Boutselakis, H., et al. (2017). COSMIC: somatic cancer genetics at high-resolution. Nucleic Acids Research, 45(D1):D777-D783.

annotators.name: cosmic_gene
annotators.title: COSMIC Gene
annotators.description: Catalogue Of Somatic Mutations In Cancer, is the world's largest and most comprehensive resource for exploring the impact of somatic mutations in human cancer.
annotators.citation: Simon A. Forbes et al; COSMIC: somatic cancer genetics at high-resolution, Nucleic Acids Research, Volume 45, Issue D1, 4 January 2017, Pages D777–D783, https://doi.org/10.1093/nar/gkw1121

annotators.name: cscape
annotators.title: CScape
annotators.description: CScape predicts the oncogenic status (disease-driver or neutral) of somatic point mutations in coding and non coding region of the cancer genome.
annotators.developer: University of Bristol Integrative Epidemiology Unit
annotators.citation: Rogers MF, Shihab H, Gaunt TR, Campbell C (2017). CScape: a tool for predicting oncogenic single-point mutations in the cancer genome. Nature Scientific Reports

annotators.name: cscape_coding
annotators.title: CScape Coding
annotators.description: CScape predicts the oncogenic status (disease-driver or neutral) of somatic point mutations in the coding region of the cancer genome.
annotators.developer: University of Bristol Integrative Epidemiology Unit
annotators.citation: Rogers MF, Shihab H, Gaunt TR, Campbell C (2017). CScape: a tool for predicting oncogenic single-point mutations in the cancer genome. Nature Scientific Reports

annotators.name: cvdkp
annotators.title: Cardiovascular Disease Knowledge Portal
annotators.description: Produces an effect weight for the variant in which disease it is found. Weights are assigned according to the strength of their association with disease risk.
annotators.citation: Cardiovascular Disease Knowledge Portal. 2020 July 14; http://www.kp4cd.org/dataset_downloads/mi

annotators.name: dann
annotators.title: DANN
annotators.description: A deep learning approach for annotating the pathogenicity of genetic variants.
annotators.developer: Center for Complex Biological Systems, University of California
annotators.citation: Quang, Daniel, Yifei Chen, and Xiaohui Xie. "DANN: a deep learning approach for annotating the pathogenicity of genetic variants." Bioinformatics 31.5 (2015): 761-763.

annotators.name: dann_coding
annotators.title: DANN Coding
annotators.description: DANN is a functional prediction score retrained based on the training data of CADD using deep neural network.
annotators.developer: Center for Complex Biological Systems, University of California
annotators.citation: Quang, Daniel, Yifei Chen, and Xiaohui Xie. "DANN: a deep learning approach for annotating the pathogenicity of genetic variants." Bioinformatics 31.5 (2015): 761-763.

annotators.name: dbcid
annotators.title: dbCID: Database of Cancer Driver InDels
annotators.description: The database of Cancer driver InDels (dbCID) is a highly curated database of driver indels (insertions and deletions) that are likely to engage in cancer development, progression, or therapy.
annotators.citation: Yue, Zhenyu et al. “dbCID: a manually curated resource for exploring the driver indels in human cancer.” Briefings in bioinformatics vol. 20,5 (2019): 1925-1933. doi:10.1093/bib/bby059

annotators.name: dbscsnv
annotators.title: dbscSNV
annotators.description: A comprehensive database of all potential human SNVs within splicing consensus regions and their functional annotations.
annotators.citation: Jian, Xueqiu, Eric Boerwinkle, and Xiaoming Liu. "In silico prediction of splice-altering single nucleotide variants in the human genome." Nucleic acids research 42.22 (2014): 13534-13544.

annotators.name: dbsnp
annotators.title: dbSNP
annotators.description: Comprehensive database of both single base nucleotide subsitutions and short deletion and insertion polymorphisms
annotators.citation: Sherry, S.T., Ward, M., Kholodov, M., Baker, J., Phan, L., Smigielski, E.M., & Sirotkin, K. (2001). dbSNP: the NCBI database of genetic variation. Nucleic acids research, 29 1, 308-11 .

annotators.name: dbsnp_common
annotators.title: dbSNP Common
annotators.description: Selection of SNPs with a minor allele frequency of 1% or greater is an attempt to identify variants that appear to be reasonably common in the general population.
annotators.citation: Sherry ST, Ward MH, Kholodov M, Baker J, Phan L, Smigielski EM, Sirotkin K. dbSNP: the NCBI database of genetic variation. Nucleic Acids Res. 2001 Jan 1;29(1):308-11. PMID: 11125122; PMC: PMC29783

annotators.name: denovo
annotators.title: Denovo-DB
annotators.description: Denovo annotation. Denovo is a collection of germline variants in the human genome which are present in children but not their parents.
annotators.citation: Turner, T.N., Yi, Q., Krumm, N., Huddleston, J., Hoekzema, K., Stessman, H.A., Doebley, A., Bernier, R.A., Nickerson, D.A., & Eichler, E.E. (2017). denovo-db: a compendium of human de novo variants. Nucleic Acids Research, 45(D1):D804-D811.

annotators.name: dgi
annotators.title: DGIdb: The Drug Interaction Database
annotators.description: The goal of DGIdb is to help you annotate your genes of interest with respect to known drug-gene interactions and potential druggability.
annotators.citation: Freshour, Sharon L., et al. "Integration of the Drug–Gene Interaction Database (DGIdb 4.0) with open crowdsource efforts." Nucleic Acids Research 49.D1 (2021): D1144-D1151.

annotators.name: encode_tfbs
annotators.title: ENCODE TFBS
annotators.description: Human transcription factor binding sites based on ChIP-seq experiments generated by production groups in the ENCODE Consortium.
annotators.citation: ENCODE Project Consortium. An integrated encyclopedia of DNA elements in the human genome. Nature 489, 57–74 (2012).

annotators.name: ensembl_regulatory_build
annotators.title: Ensembl Regulatory Build
annotators.description: An up-to-date and comprehensive summary of regulatory features across the genome, as well as popular curated external resources.
annotators.citation: Zerbino DR, Wilder SP, Johnson N, Juettemann T, Flicek PR. The ensembl regulatory build. Genome Biology. 2015 Mar;16:56. DOI: 10.1186/s13059-015-0621-5.

annotators.name: esm1b
annotators.title: ESM1b
annotators.description: ESM1b is a 650-million-parameter protein language model to predict all ~450 million possible missense variant effects in the human genome.
annotators.citation: Brandes, N., Goldman, G., Wang, C.H. et al. Genome-wide prediction of disease variant effects with a deep protein language model. Nat Genet 55, 1512–1522 (2023). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41588-023-01465-0

annotators.name: esp6500
annotators.title: ESP6500
annotators.description: Exome Sequencing Project 6500
annotators.citation: Exome Variant Server, NHLBI GO Exome Sequencing Project (ESP), Seattle, WA

annotators.name: ess_gene
annotators.title: Essential Genes
annotators.description: Essential Genes provides a database of genetic variation & mutational burden in 2472 human orthologs
annotators.developer: Department of Genetics, University of Pennsylvania
annotators.citation: Georgi, B., Voight, B.F., & Bucan, M. (2013). From Mouse to Human: Evolutionary Genomics Analysis of Human Orthologs of Essential Genes. PLoS genetics 9(5): e1003484.

annotators.name: eve
annotators.title: EVE
annotators.description: EVE is a unsupervised model designed to predict the clinical relevance of human single amino acid variants by examining the sequences of various organisms throughout evolutionary history.
annotators.citation: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41586-021-04043-8

annotators.name: exac_gene
annotators.title: ExAC Gene and CNV
annotators.description: ExAC Functional Gene Constraint & CNV Scores provides probability of LoF tolerance/intolerance
annotators.citation: Lek, M., Karczewski, K. J., Minikel, E. V., et al. (2016). Analysis of protein-coding genetic variation in 60,706 humans. Nature, 536(7616), 285.

annotators.name: fathmm
annotators.title: FATHMM
annotators.description: Functional analysis through hidden markov models.
annotators.developer: University of Bristol Integrative Epidemiology Unit
annotators.citation: Shihab, H. A., Gough, J., Mort, M., Cooper, D. N., Day, I. N., & Gaunt, T. R. (2014). Ranking non-synonymous single nucleotide polymorphisms based on disease concepts. Human genomics, 8(1), 11.

annotators.name: fathmm_mkl
annotators.title: FATHMM MKL
annotators.description: A database capable of predicting the effects of coding variants using nucleotide-based HMMs.
annotators.developer: University of Bristol Integrative Epidemiology Unit
annotators.citation: Shihab, Hashem A., et al. "An integrative approach to predicting the functional effects of non-coding and coding sequence variation." Bioinformatics 31.10 (2015): 1536-1543.

annotators.name: fathmm_xf
annotators.title: FATHMM XF
annotators.description: Enhanced Accuracy in Predicting the Functional Consequences of Coding Single Nucleotide Variants (SNVs).
annotators.developer: University of Bristol Integrative Epidemiology Unit
annotators.citation: Rogers, Mark F., et al. "Supplementary information for FATHMM-XF: accurate prediction of pathogenic point mutations via extended features." (2015).

annotators.name: fathmm_xf_coding
annotators.title: FATHMM XF Coding
annotators.description: Enhanced Accuracy in Predicting the Functional Consequences of Coding Single Nucleotide Variants (SNVs).
annotators.developer: University of Bristol Integrative Epidemiology Unit
annotators.citation: Rogers, Mark F., et al. "Supplementary information for FATHMM-XF: accurate prediction of pathogenic point mutations via extended features." (2015).

annotators.name: fitcons
annotators.title: fitCons
annotators.description: fitCons predicts the fraction of genomic positions belonging to a specific function class that are under selective pressure.
annotators.developer: Department of Biological Statistics & Computational Biology, Cornell University
annotators.citation: Gulko, Brad, et al. "A method for calculating probabilities of fitness consequences for point mutations across the human genome." Nature genetics 47.3 (2015): 276-283.

annotators.name: flank_seq
annotators.title: Flanking Sequence
annotators.description: Reference and alternate bases with flanking sequence
annotators.citation: Wood, M. A., et al. (2018). neoepiscope Improves Neoepitope Prediction with Multi-variant Phasing. BioRxiv, 418129.

annotators.name: funseq2
annotators.title: FunSeq2
annotators.description: A flexible framework to prioritize regulatory mutations from cancer genome sequencing
annotators.citation: Fu, Y., Liu, Z., Lou, S. et al. FunSeq2: a framework for prioritizing noncoding regulatory variants in cancer. Genome Biol 15, 480 (2014). https://doi.org/10.1186/s13059-014-0480-5

annotators.name: genehancer
annotators.title: GeneHancer
annotators.description: GeneHancer is a database of genome-wide enhancer-to-gene and promoter-to-gene associations.
annotators.citation: Rosen, N., V. Chalifa-Caspi, O. Shmueli, A. Adato, M. Lapidot, J. Stampnitzky, M. Safran, and D. Lancet (2003). GeneLoc: Exon-based integration of human genome maps. Bioinformatics 19(S1). URL: http://genecards.weizmann.ac.il/geneloc

annotators.name: genocanyon
annotators.title: GenoCanyon
annotators.description: GenoCanyon is a whole-genome functional annotation approach based on unsupervised statistical learning. It integrates genomic conservation measures and biochemical annotation data to predict the functional potential at each nucleotid.
annotators.citation: Lu, Q., Hu, Y., Sun, J. et al. A Statistical Framework to Predict Functional Non-Coding Regions in the Human Genome Through Integrated Analysis of Annotation Data. Sci Rep 5, 10576 (2015). https://doi.org/10.1038/srep10576

annotators.name: gerp
annotators.title: GERP++
annotators.description: Genomic Evolutionary Rate Profiling
annotators.citation: Davydov, E. V., Goode, D. L., Sirota, M., Cooper, G. M., Sidow, A., & Batzoglou, S. (2010). Identifying a high fraction of the human genome to be under selective constraint using GERP++. PLoS computational biology, 6(12), e1001025.

annotators.name: geuvadis
annotators.title: Geuvadis eQTLs
annotators.description: Significant snp-gene associations reported by the Geuvadis project
annotators.citation: Lappalainen, Tuuli, et al. "Transcriptome and genome sequencing uncovers functional variation in humans." Nature 501.7468 (2013): 506-511.

annotators.name: ghis
annotators.title: GHIS
annotators.description: Gene haploinsufficiency scoring
annotators.developer: 1MRC Functional Genomics Unit, University of Oxford
annotators.citation: Steinberg, J., Honti, F., Meader, S., & Webber, C. (2015). Haploinsufficiency predictions without study bias. Nucleic acids research, 43(15), e101-e101.

annotators.name: gmvp
annotators.title: gMVP
annotators.description: gMVP is a graph attention neural network
annotators.citation: https://www.nature.com/articles/s42256-022-00561-w

annotators.name: gnomad
annotators.title: gnomAD
annotators.description: Genome Aggregation Database (gnomAD) is a resource developed by an international coalition of investigators, with the goal of aggregating and harmonizing both exome and genome sequencing data from a wide variety of large-scale sequencing projects
annotators.citation: Lek, M., Karczewski, K. J., Minikel, E. V., et al. (2016). Analysis of protein-coding genetic variation in 60,706 humans. Nature, 536(7616), 285.

annotators.name: gnomad3
annotators.title: gnomAD3
annotators.description: Genome Aggregation Database (gnomAD) is a resource developed by an international coalition of investigators, with the goal of aggregating and harmonizing both exome and genome sequencing data from a wide variety of large-scale sequencing projects
annotators.citation: Karczewski, Konrad J., et al. "The Mutational Constraint Spectrum Quantified from Variation in 141,456 Humans." BioRxiv, Apr. 2020, p. 531210. www.biorxiv.org, doi:10.1101/531210.

annotators.name: gnomad3_counts
annotators.title: gnomAD3 Counts
annotators.description: Genome Aggregation Database (gnomAD) is a resource developed by an international coalition of investigators, with the goal of aggregating and harmonizing both exome and genome sequencing data from a wide variety of large-scale sequencing projects
annotators.citation: Karczewski, Konrad J., et al. "The Mutational Constraint Spectrum Quantified from Variation in 141,456 Humans." BioRxiv, Apr. 2020, p. 531210. www.biorxiv.org, doi:10.1101/531210.

annotators.name: gnomad4
annotators.title: gnomAD4
annotators.description: Genome Aggregation Database (gnomAD) is a resource developed by an international coalition of investigators, with the goal of aggregating and harmonizing both exome and genome sequencing data from a wide variety of large-scale sequencing projects

annotators.name: gnomad_gene
annotators.title: gnomAD Gene
annotators.description: Gene level population statistics from gnomAD
annotators.citation: https://www.nature.com/articles/nature19057

annotators.name: go
annotators.title: Gene Ontology
annotators.description: Gene Ontology (GO) project provides a comprehensive computable knowledge regarding the functions of genes and gene products.
annotators.citation: Ashburner, M., Ball, C. A., Blake, J. A., et al. (2000). Gene Ontology: tool for the unification of biology. Nature genetics, 25(1), 25.

annotators.name: grasp
annotators.title: GRASP
annotators.description: Genome-Wide Repository of Associations Between SNPs and Phenotypes
annotators.citation: Leslie R, O’Donnell CJ, Johnson AD (2014) GRASP: analysis of genotype-phenotype results from 1,390 genome-wide association studies and corresponding open access database. Bioinformatics 30(12), i185-94

annotators.name: gtex
annotators.title: GTEx eQTLs
annotators.description: Genotype-tissue expression
annotators.developer: The Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard
annotators.citation: https://gtexportal.org/home/faq#citePortal

annotators.name: gwas_catalog
annotators.title: GWAS Catalog
annotators.description: GWAS Catalog Annotator
annotators.citation: Buniello A, MacArthur JAL, Cerezo M, Harris LW, Hayhurst J, Malangone C, McMahon A, Morales J, Mountjoy E, Sollis E, Suveges D, Vrousgou O, Whetzel PL, Amode R, Guillen JA, Riat HS, Trevanion SJ, Hall P, Junkins H, Flicek P, Burdett T, Hindorff LA, Cunningham F and Parkinson H. The NHGRI-EBI GWAS Catalog of published genome-wide association studies, targeted arrays and summary statistics 2019. Nucleic Acids Research, 2019, Vol. 47 (Database issue): D1005-D1012.

annotators.name: hg19
annotators.title: hg19 coordinates
annotators.description: Input coordinates are mapped to hg19 through liftOver.

annotators.name: hgdp
annotators.title: HGDP
annotators.description: Human Genome Diversity Panel (HGDP) DNA from individuals among 51 different populations.

annotators.name: hpo
annotators.title: Human Phenotype Ontology
annotators.description: The Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) provides a standardized vocabulary of phenotypic abnormalities encountered in human disease. Each term in the HPO describes a phenotypic abnormality.
annotators.citation: Koehler, Sebastian et al. The Human Phenotype Ontology in 2021.Nucleic acids research vol. 49,D1 (2021): D1207-D1217. doi:10.1093/nar/gkaa1043

annotators.name: intact
annotators.title: IntAct
annotators.description: Molecular interaction data
annotators.citation: Orchard, S., Ammari, M., Aranda, B., et al. (2013). The MIntAct projectâ€”IntAct as a common curation platform for 11 molecular interaction databases. Nucleic acids research, 42(D1), D358-D363.

annotators.name: interpro
annotators.title: InterPro
annotators.description: Protein sequence analysis & classification
annotators.citation: Mitchell, A. L., Attwood, T. K., Babbitt, P. C., et al. (2018). InterPro in 2019: improving coverage, classification and access to protein sequence annotations. Nucleic acids research, 47(D1), D351-D360.

annotators.name: javierre_promoters
annotators.title: Promoter IR
annotators.description: Javierre et al promoter-interacting regions | Promoter capture Hi-C was used to identify interacting regions of 31,253 promoters that are significantly associated across 17 human primary hematopoietic cell types.
annotators.developer: The Babraham Institute, Babraham Research Campus, Cambridge
annotators.citation: Javierre, B. M., Burren S.E. et al. (2016). Lineage-specific genome architecture links enhancers and non-coding disease variants to target gene promoters. Cell, 167(5), 1369-1384.

annotators.name: linsight
annotators.title: LINSIGHT
annotators.description: LINSIGHT
annotators.citation: Huang, Y. F., Gulko, B., & Siepel, A. (2017). Fast, scalable prediction of deleterious noncoding variants from functional and population genomic data. Nature genetics, 49(4), 618.

annotators.name: litvar
annotators.title: LitVar
annotators.description: LitVar allows the search and retrieval of variant relevant information from biomedical literature.
annotators.citation: Allot, Alexis, et al. "LitVar: a semantic search engine for linking genomic variant data in PubMed and PMC." Nucleic acids research 46.W1 (2018): W530-W536.

annotators.name: litvar_full
annotators.title: LitVar Full
annotators.description: LitVar allows the search and retrieval of variant relevant information from biomedical literature.
annotators.citation: Allot, Alexis, et al. "LitVar: a semantic search engine for linking genomic variant data in PubMed and PMC." Nucleic acids research 46.W1 (2018): W530-W536.

annotators.name: loftool
annotators.title: LoFtool
annotators.description: Gene intolerance score based on loss-of-function variants
annotators.citation: Fadista, J., Oskolkov, N., Hansson, O., & Groop, L. (2016). LoFtool: a gene intolerance score based on loss-of-function variants in 60 706 individuals. Bioinformatics, 33(4), 471-474.

annotators.name: lrt
annotators.title: Likelihood Ratio Test
annotators.description: The likelihood ratio test (LRT) can accurately identify a subset of deleterious mutations that disrupt highly conserved amino acids within protein-coding sequences.
annotators.developer: Computational Biology Program, University of Washington
annotators.citation: Chun, Sung, and Justin C. Fay. "Identification of deleterious mutations within three human genomes." Genome research 19.9 (2009): 1553-1561.

annotators.name: mavedb
annotators.title: MaveDB
annotators.description: MaveDB is a public repository for datasets from Multiplexed Assays of Variant Effect (MAVEs).
annotators.developer: University of Washington, Department of Genome Sciences
annotators.citation: Esposito, Daniel, et al. "MaveDB: an open-source platform to distribute and interpret data from multiplexed assays of variant effect." Genome biology 20.1 (2019): 1-11.

annotators.name: metalr
annotators.title: MetaLR
annotators.description: MetaLR creates an ensemble-based prediction score by using machine learning and logistic regression.
annotators.developer: University of Southern California, Biostatistics Department
annotators.citation: Dong C, Wei P, Jian X, Gibbs R, Boerwinkle E, Wang K* and Liu X*. (2015) Comparison and integration of deleteriousness prediction methods for nonsynonymous SNVs in whole exome sequencing studies. Human Molecular Genetics 24(8):2125-2137.

annotators.name: metarnn
annotators.title: MetaRNN
annotators.description: Recurrent neural network predictor using an ensembl of 16 sub-predictors
annotators.citation: https://genomemedicine.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s13073-022-01120-z

annotators.name: metasvm
annotators.title: MetaSVM
annotators.description: MetaSVM creates an ensemble-based prediction score by using a support vector machine model.
annotators.developer: University of Southern California, Biostatistics Department
annotators.citation: Dong C, Wei P, Jian X, Gibbs R, Boerwinkle E, Wang K* and Liu X*. (2015) Comparison and integration of deleteriousness prediction methods for nonsynonymous SNVs in whole exome sequencing studies. Human Molecular Genetics 24(8):2125-2137.

annotators.name: mirbase
annotators.title: miRBase
annotators.description: A microRNA database is a searchable database of published miRNA sequences and annotation.
annotators.developer: Faculty of Biology, Medicine, and Health, Uninversity of Manchester
annotators.citation: Kozomara, Ana, and Sam Griffiths-Jones. "miRBase: annotating high confidence microRNAs using deep sequencing data." Nucleic acids research 42.D1 (2014): D68-D73

annotators.name: mistic
annotators.title: MISTIC (MISsense deleTeriousness predICtor)
annotators.description: A supervised machine-learning model dedicated to the prediction of deleterious missense variants.
annotators.citation: Chennen K, Weber T, Lornage X, Kress A, Böhm J, Thompson J, Laporte J, Poch O. MISTIC: A prediction tool to reveal disease-relevant deleterious missense variants. 2020 Jul 31;15(7):e0236962. doi: https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0236962. eCollection 2020.

annotators.name: mitomap
annotators.title: MITOMAP
annotators.description: The MITOMAP database of human mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) information has been an important compilation of mtDNA variation for researchers, clinicians and genetic counselors.
annotators.citation: Lott, et al., mtDNA variation and analysis using MITOMAP and MITOMASTER, Current Protocols in Bioinformatics 44:1.23.1-1.23.26 (December 2013).

annotators.name: mupit
annotators.title: MuPIT
annotators.description: Provides links to variant position and annotations in 3D MuPIT structure viewer.
annotators.citation: Niknafs, N., Kim, D., Kim, R., et al. (2013). MuPIT interactive: webserver for mapping variant positions to annotated, interactive 3D structures. Human genetics, 132(11), 1235-1243.

annotators.name: mutation_assessor
annotators.title: Mutation Assessor
annotators.description: Mutation Assessor is a database providing prediction of the functional impact of amino-acid substitutions in proteins
annotators.citation: Reva, B., Antipin, Y., & Sander, C. (2007). Determinants of protein function revealed by combinatorial entropy optimization. Genome biology, 8(11), R232.

annotators.name: mutationtaster
annotators.title: MutationTaster
annotators.description: Evaluates disease-causing potential of sequence alterations
annotators.developer: Department of Neuropediatrics, “Charité–Universitätsmedizin Berlin”, Berlin, Germany
annotators.citation: Schwarz, J., Rödelsperger, C., Schuelke, M. et al. MutationTaster evaluates disease-causing potential of sequence alterations. Nat Methods 7, 575–576 (2010). https://doi.org/10.1038/nmeth0810-575

annotators.name: mutpanning
annotators.title: Mutpanning
annotators.description: Discovers new tumor genes in aggregated sequencing data.
annotators.citation: Detlein, Felix, et al. "Identification of cancer driver genes based on nucleotide context." Nature Genetics 52.2 (2020): 208-218.

annotators.name: mutpred1
annotators.title: MutPred
annotators.description: MutPred is a random forest model for the prediction of pathogenic missense variants and automated inference of molecular mechanisms of disease.
annotators.citation: Li B, Krishnan VG, Mort ME, Xin F, Kamati KK, Cooper DN, Mooney SD, Radivojac P. Automated inference of molecular mechanisms of disease from amino acid substitutions. Bioinformatics (2009) 25(21): 2744-2750.

annotators.name: mutpred_indel
annotators.title: MutPred-Indel
annotators.description: A web application developed to classify human non-frameshifting indels as pathogenic or benign. In addition, it predicts their impact on over 50 different protein properties and, thus, enables the inference of molecular mechanisms of pathogenicity.
annotators.citation: Pagel, Kymberleigh A., et al. "Pathogenicity and functional impact of non-frameshifting insertion/deletion variation in the human genome." PLoS computational biology 15.6 (2019): e1007112.

annotators.name: ncbigene
annotators.title: NCBI Gene
annotators.description: Gene description from NIH's NCBI Gene Info
annotators.citation: Wheeler, D. L., Barrett, T., Benson, D. A., Bryant, S. H., et al. (2006). Database resources of the national center for biotechnology information. Nucleic acids research, 35(suppl_1), D5-D12.

annotators.name: ncer
annotators.title: ncER: non-coding essential regulation
annotators.description: ncER has a good performance for the identification of deleterious variants in the non-coding genome. ncER can also identify non-coding regions associated with cell viability, an in vitro surrogate of essentiality9, and with regulation of an essential gene.
annotators.developer: Department of Integrative Structural and Computational Biology, The Scripps Research Institute
annotators.citation: Wells, A., Heckerman, D., Torkamani, A. et al. Ranking of non-coding pathogenic variants and putative essential regions of the human genome. Nat Commun 10, 5241 (2019). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41467-019-13212-3

annotators.name: ncrna
annotators.title: ncRNA
annotators.description: Non-coding RNA from RepeatMasker library
annotators.citation: Bao, W., Kojima, K. K., & Kohany, O. (2015). Repbase Update, a database of repetitive elements in eukaryotic genomes. Mobile DNA, 6(1), 11.

annotators.name: ndex
annotators.title: NDEx NCI Cancer Pathways
annotators.description: Network Data Exchange
annotators.citation: Pratt, D., Chen, J., Welker, D., et al. (2015). NDEx, the network data exchange. Cell systems, 1(4), 302-305.

annotators.name: ndex_chd
annotators.title: NDEx Congenital Heart Disease
annotators.description: Network Data Exchange Congenital Heart Disease Pathways
annotators.citation: Pratt, D., Chen, J., Welker, D., et al. (2015). NDEx, the network data exchange. Cell systems, 1(4), 302-305.

annotators.name: ndex_signor
annotators.title: NDEx SIGNOR
annotators.description: Network Data Exchange Signor Pathways
annotators.citation: Pratt, D., Chen, J., Welker, D., et al. (2015). NDEx, the network data exchange. Cell systems, 1(4), 302-305.

annotators.name: omim
annotators.title: OMIM
annotators.description: Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man. Catalog of human genes and genetic disorders and traits.
annotators.citation: Amberger JS, Bocchini CA, Scott AF, Hamosh A. OMIM.org: leveraging knowledge across phenotype-gene relationships. Nucleic Acids Res. 2019 Jan 8;47(D1):D1038-D1043. doi:10.1093/nar/gky1151. PMID: 30445645.

annotators.name: oncokb
annotators.title: OncoKB
annotators.description: *Local Installation Use Only* OncoKB is a precision oncology knowledge base that annotates the biological consequences and clinical implications (therapeutic, diagnostic, and prognostic) of genetic variants in cancer.
annotators.citation: Chakravarty, Debyani, et al. "OncoKB: a precision oncology knowledge base." JCO precision oncology 1 (2017): 1-16.

annotators.name: pangalodb
annotators.title: PangaloDB
annotators.description: PanglaoDB is a single cell gene expression resource for the scientific community. The goal of this database is to provide exploration of single cell RNA sequencing experiments.
annotators.developer: Integrated Cardio Metabolic Centre at Karolinska Institutet.
annotators.citation: Oscar Franzén, Li-Ming Gan, Johan L M Björkegren, PanglaoDB: a web server for exploration of mouse and human single-cell RNA sequencing data, Database, Volume 2019, 2019, baz046, https://doi.org/10.1093/database/baz046

annotators.name: pharmgkb
annotators.title: PharmGKB
annotators.description: Clinically actionable gene-drug associations and genotype-phenotype relationships
annotators.developer: Shriram Center for Bioengineering and Chemical Engineering
annotators.citation: M. Whirl-Carrillo, E.M. McDonagh, J. M. Hebert, L. Gong, K. Sangkuhl, C.F. Thorn, R.B. Altman and T.E. Klein. "Pharmacogenomics Knowledge for Personalized Medicine" Clinical Pharmacology & Therapeutics (2012) 92(4): 414-417

annotators.name: phastcons
annotators.title: Phast Cons
annotators.description: A database of compressed phastCons conservation scores.
annotators.developer: University of California Santa Cruz Genomics Institute
annotators.citation: Pollard, K. S., Hubisz, M. J., Rosenbloom, K. R., & Siepel, A. (2010). Detection of nonneutral substitution rates on mammalian phylogenies. Genome research, 20(1), 110-121.

annotators.name: phdsnpg
annotators.title: PhD-SNPg
annotators.description: A binary classifier for predicting pathogenic variants in coding and non-coding regions.
annotators.citation: Capriotti, E., & Fariselli, P. (2017). PhD-SNPg: a webserver and lightweight tool for scoring single nucleotide variants. Nucleic acids research, 45(W1), W247-W252.

annotators.name: phi
annotators.title: p(HI)
annotators.description: Providing probabilities for gene-based haploinsufficiency
annotators.citation: Huang, N., Lee, I., Marcotte, E. M., & Hurles, M. E. (2010). Characterising and predicting haploinsufficiency in the human genome. PLoS genetics, 6(10), e1001154.

annotators.name: phylop
annotators.title: PhyloP
annotators.description: A database providing conservation scoring by phylogenetic p-values
annotators.developer: University of California Santa Cruz Genomics Institute
annotators.citation: Pollard, K. S., Hubisz, M. J., Rosenbloom, K. R., & Siepel, A. (2010). Detection of nonneutral substitution rates on mammalian phylogenies. Genome research, 20(1), 110-121.

annotators.name: polyphen2
annotators.title: PolyPhen-2
annotators.description: PolyPhen-2 (Polymorphism Phenotyping v2) is a tool which predicts possible impact of an amino acid substitution on the structure and function of a human protein using straightforward physical and comparative considerations
annotators.citation: Adzhubei IA, Schmidt S, Peshkin L, Ramensky VE, Gerasimova A, Bork P, Kondrashov AS, Sunyaev SR. Nat Methods 7(4):248-249 (2010).

annotators.name: prec
annotators.title: P(rec)
annotators.description: Providing probabilities for LoF alleles
annotators.citation: MacArthur, D. G., Balasubramanian, S., Frankish, A., et al. (2012). A systematic survey of loss-of-function variants in human protein-coding genes. Science, 335(6070), 823-828.

annotators.name: primateai
annotators.title: PrimateAI
annotators.description: Deep residual neural network for classifying the pathogenicity of missense mutations
annotators.developer: Illumina Artificial Intelligence Laboratory, Illumina Inc, San Diego, CA, USA
annotators.citation: Sundaram, L., Gao, H., Padigepati, S.R. et al. Predicting the clinical impact of human mutation with deep neural networks. Nat Genet 50, 1161–1170 (2018). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41588-018-0167-z

annotators.name: provean
annotators.title: PROVEAN: Protein Variant Effect Analyzer
annotators.description: A tool to predict the functional effect of amino acid substitutions and indels.
annotators.citation: Choi Y, Chan AP (2015) PROVEAN web server: a tool to predict the functional effect of amino acid substitutions and indels. Bioinformatics 31(16): 2745-2747.

annotators.name: pseudogene
annotators.title: Pseudogene
annotators.description: Pseudogenes from UCSC hg38 wgEncodeGencodePseudoGeneV46
annotators.citation: Harrow, J., Frankish, A., Gonzalez, J. M., Tapanari, E., Diekhans, M., Kokocinski, F., ... & Barnes, I. (2012). GENCODE: the reference human genome annotation for The ENCODE Project. Genome research, 22(9), 1760-1774.

annotators.name: pubmed
annotators.title: PubMed
annotators.description: PubMed articles related to a particular gene

annotators.name: regeneron
annotators.title: Regeneron
annotators.description: Allele counts and frequencies from the Regeneron Million Exomes dataset.
annotators.developer: Regeneron Genetics Center and Baylor College of Medicine Human Genome Sequencing Center
annotators.citation: Sun, K. Y. et al. A deep catalogue of protein-coding variation in 983,578 individuals. Nature 631, 583–592 (2024).

annotators.name: regulomedb
annotators.title: RegulomeDB
annotators.description: Identifies DNA features and regulatory elements in non-coding regions of the human genome.
annotators.citation: Boyle AP, Hong EL, Hariharan M, Cheng Y, Schaub MA, Kasowski M, Karczewski KJ, Park J, Hitz BC, Weng S, Cherry JM, Snyder M. Annotation of functional variation in personal genomes usingRegulomeDB. Genome Research 2012, 22(9):1790-1797. PMID: 22955989.

annotators.name: repeat
annotators.title: Repeat Sequences
annotators.description: Repeating elements from RepeatMasker and Simple Repeat tracks of UCSC hg38 database. UCSC Genome Browser Tracks rmsk and simpleRepeat were used to obtain Low complexity, SINE, LINE, LTR, Simple Repeat, and Satellite data and they were combined.
annotators.citation: Haeussler, M., Zweig, A. S., Tyner, C., et al. (2018). The UCSC Genome Browser database: 2019 update. Nucleic acids research, 47(D1), D853-D858.

annotators.name: revel
annotators.title: REVEL
annotators.description: Rare Exome Variant Ensemble Learner
annotators.developer: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai
annotators.citation: Ioannidis, N. M., Rothstein, J. H., Pejaver, V., et al. (2016). REVEL: an ensemble method for predicting the pathogenicity of rare missense variants. The American Journal of Human Genetics, 99(4), 877-885.

annotators.name: rvis
annotators.title: RVIS
annotators.description: Residual variation intolerance scoring
annotators.developer: Center for Human Genome Variation, Duke University
annotators.citation: Petrovski, S., Wang, Q., Heinzen, E. L., Allen, A. S., & Goldstein, D. B. (2013). Genic intolerance to functional variation and the interpretation of personal genomes. PLoS genetics, 9(8), e1003709.

annotators.name: segway
annotators.title: Segway
annotators.description: Chromatin state activity scores
annotators.citation: Libbrecht, Maxwell W., et al. "A unified encyclopedia of human functional DNA elements through fully automated annotation of 164 human cell types." Genome Biology 20.1 (2019): 1-14.

annotators.name: sift
annotators.title: SIFT
annotators.description: SIFT predicts whether an amino acid substitution affects protein function
annotators.developer: Bioinformatics Institute, Agency for Science, Technology and Research, Singapore
annotators.citation: Vaser R, Adusumalli S, Leng SN, Sikic M, Ng PC (2016) SIFT missense predictions for genomes. Nat Protocols 11: 1-9.

annotators.name: siphy
annotators.title: SiPhy
annotators.description: A database of conservation scores based on 29 mammal genomes
annotators.citation: Lindblad-Toh, K., Garber, M., Zuk, et al. (2011). A high-resolution map of human evolutionary constraint using 29 mammals. Nature, 478(7370), 476.

annotators.name: spliceai
annotators.title: SpliceAI
annotators.description: A deep neural network that accurately predicts splice junctions from an arbitrary pre-mRNA transcript sequence, enabling precise prediction of noncoding genetic variants that cause cryptic splicing.
annotators.citation: Jaganathan, Kishore, et al. "Predicting splicing from primary sequence with deep learning." Cell 176.3 (2019): 535-548.

annotators.name: swissprot_binding
annotators.title: Swiss-Prot Binding
annotators.description: Provides any useful information about the protein, mostly binding sites.
annotators.citation: The UniProt Consortium, UniProt: a hub for protein information, Nucleic Acids Research, Volume 43, Issue D1, 28 January 2015, Pages D204–D212, https://doi.org/10.1093/nar/gku989

annotators.name: swissprot_domains
annotators.title: Swiss-Prot Domains
annotators.description: Provides information on location,topology, and domain(s) of a protein.
annotators.citation: The UniProt Consortium, UniProt: a worldwide hub of protein knowledge, Nucleic Acids Research, Volume 47, Issue D1, 08 January 2019, Pages D506–D515, https://doi.org/10.1093/nar/gky1049

annotators.name: swissprot_ptm
annotators.title: Swiss-Prot PTM
annotators.description: A high quality manually annotated protein sequence database, specifying in post-translational modifications (PTMs).
annotators.citation: Khoury, George A., Richard C. Baliban, and Christodoulos A. Floudas. "Proteome-wide post-translational modification statistics: frequency analysis and curation of the swiss-prot database." Scientific reports 1 (2011): 90.

annotators.name: target
annotators.title: TARGET
annotators.description: Tumor Alterations Relevant for GEnomics-driven Therapy
annotators.citation: Van Allen, E. M., Wagle, N., Stojanov, P., et al. (2014). Whole-exome sequencing and clinical interpretation of formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded tumor samples to guide precision cancer medicine. Nature medicine, 20(6), 682.

annotators.name: thousandgenomes
annotators.title: 1000 Genomes
annotators.description: Population allele frequencies from 1000 Genomes Project
annotators.citation: 1000 Genomes Project Consortium. (2015). A global reference for human genetic variation. Nature, 526(7571), 68.

annotators.name: thousandgenomes_ad_mixed_american
annotators.title: 1000 Genomes-Ad Mixed American
annotators.description: Population allele frequencies from 1000 Genomes Project
annotators.citation: 1000 Genomes Project Consortium. (2015). A global reference for human genetic variation. Nature, 526(7571), 68.

annotators.name: thousandgenomes_african
annotators.title: 1000 Genomes-African
annotators.description: Population allele frequencies from 1000 Genomes Project
annotators.citation: 1000 Genomes Project Consortium. (2015). A global reference for human genetic variation. Nature, 526(7571), 68.

annotators.name: thousandgenomes_east_asian
annotators.title: 1000 Genomes-East Asian
annotators.description: Population allele frequencies from 1000 Genomes Project
annotators.citation: 1000 Genomes Project Consortium. (2015). A global reference for human genetic variation. Nature, 526(7571), 68.

annotators.name: thousandgenomes_european
annotators.title: 1000 Genomes-European
annotators.description: Population allele frequencies from 1000 Genomes Project
annotators.citation: 1000 Genomes Project Consortium. (2015). A global reference for human genetic variation. Nature, 526(7571), 68.

annotators.name: thousandgenomes_south_asian

annotators.description: Population allele frequencies from 1000 Genomes Project
annotators.citation: 1000 Genomes Project Consortium. (2015). A global reference for human genetic variation. Nature, 526(7571), 68.

annotators.name: trinity
annotators.title: Trinity CTAT
annotators.description: Trinity assembles transcript sequences from Illumina RNA-Seq data.
annotators.citation: Grabherr MG, Haas BJ, Yassour M, Levin JZ, Thompson DA, Amit I, Adiconis X, Fan L, Raychowdhury R, Zeng Q, Chen Z, Mauceli E, Hacohen N, Gnirke A, Rhind N, di Palma F, Birren BW, Nusbaum C, Lindblad-Toh K, Friedman N, Regev A. Full-length transcriptome assembly from RNA-seq data without a reference genome. Nat Biotechnol. 2011 May 15;29(7):644-52. doi: 10.1038/nbt.1883. PubMed PMID: 21572440.
